Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah scored his first international goal in the 12th minute.
Michel Aebischer scored his first international goal with a superb curling shot from outside the box on the stroke of half-time.
Barnabás Varga scored for Hungary in the 66th minute with a header from Dominik Szoboszlai's cross.
Breel Embolo sealed the win for Switzerland with a goal in stoppage time.
Post-Match Reflections: Swiss coach Murat Yakin praised his team's tactics and execution, likening football to chess.
Hungary coach Marco Rossi took responsibility for his team's errors and passive first-half performance.
Granit Xhaka was named player of the match for his vital role in controlling the pace of play and delivering pinpoint passes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Switzerland made a strong start to their Euro 2024 campaign with a 3-1 win over Hungary.
Hungary's 14-game unbeaten run ended recently, and this was their third successive European Championship appearance.
Dominik Szoboszlai made his debut in the tournament as the youngest captain in the Euros at 23 years old.
The match was held at RheinEnergieSTADION in Köln, Germany, with an attendance of 41,676.
